originalText.text: I liked the representative that worked with me because he answered every question I had and made sure I understood everything. However, one of the aspects of the process is acquiring a loan that surpassed my need but if the amount changed prior to need, the excess would be returned and the life of the terms would change. I've never had this option occur with any loan I've secured before.  Moreover, the rate is manageable. Overall, Reach financial appears to be what I need but request this review in a couple of months after the loan commence to observe if any hiccups occur. So far, a great experience. Thanks.

Overall, Reach financial appears to be what I need but request this review in a couple of months after the loan commence to observe if any hiccups occur. So far, a great experience. Thanks.

originalText.text:
I wanted to let you know about your employee, Nicole.  She is a asset to your company.  Because of the way she explained the program and how very sincere she was, it helped me make up my mind to  enter into the program.  I had many questions and when she called me back on Wednesday, September 13th, Nicole answered all my questions and put my mind to ease.  Being that I am getting up in age I don’t understand some things so patience and gentleness is needed to help me realize what the program is all about.  She is soft spoken and kind, everything I needed to reach my decision.
I had to let you know how glad I spoke to Nicole she made me feel like family.

originalText.text: Great customer service.. I would not hesitate to recommend Reach financial services to my family or friends for their financial assistance .. absolutely great company..

text.text: Great customer service.. I would not hesitate to recommend Reach financial services to my family or friends for their financial assistance .. absolutely great company..

originalText.text: All the professionals I have spoken with at Reach have been very helpful to me.  I have always been pleased. Thanks to all for your personal attention to me.

text.text: All the professionals I have spoken with at Reach have been very helpful to me.  I have always been pleased. Thanks to all for your personal attention to me.

originalText.text: Bad news is, this entity only helps people who are well off, and not poor people in a bad way. They left me, a disabled veteran out to twist in the wind. Unbelievable. They have calculation chart to where one needs at least $7,500 to qualify, and I have below that. It is because this entity gets compensated by the creditors some how and it's not worth their time for what they consider a small debt. Useless. Not recommended unless you are BURIED in debt, because they need to make money off you. I thought it was a non-profit organization. So my only option left is Chapter 13 bankruptcy, which has some real teeth, cuts the interest rate to zero on all creditors at an affordable monthly payment that will take less than half the time (36 months) to have the debts discharged and give me a fresh start, which National Debt Hindrance found a reason NOT to do. Absolutely not recommended, again, in spite of any after-the-fact comments they have.
